title: Increased water conservation in agriculture
description: How do advanced features of 6G minimize water wastage?

title: Increased energy efficiency in agriculture
description: How do advanced features of 6G contribute to lower energy consumption?

title: Increased soil health maintenance
description: How do advanced features of 6G contribute to ensuring optimal soil health and fertility and long-term soil conservation through timely monitoring and interventions?

title: Increased contribution to climate resilience
description: How do advanced features of 6G contribute to developing adaptive strategies to mitigate the impact of climate change on cultivation, such as drought resistance testing and phenological monitoring, to enhance and ensure continued productivity in changing environmental conditions?

title: Waste reduction
description: How does this service contribute to reduced waste generated through packaging and disposal compared to traditional wound care products?

title: Environmental regulatory compliance
description: How does the project ensure compliance with regulations governing water usage and conservation practices in agricultural settings?

title: Environmental regulatory compliance
description: How does the project engage with policies on environmental protection and counteracting the effects of climate change?

title: Energy efficiency improvements
description: Model predictive control at the digital twin allows the proactive allocation of resources, anticipating changes in connectivity and traffic requirements that may cause a spike in usages of energy and spectral resources.

title: Energy efficiency improvements
description: CSI compression will reduce the amount of information that needs to be transmitted between the UE and gNB. The smaller CSI payload will lead to decreased energy consumption at both the UE and gNB.

title: Energy efficiency improvements
description: AI/ML based MIMO precoding will reduce unnecessary radiation and hence, energy consumption. This will result in increased energy efficiency.

title: Energy efficiency improvements
description: Dynamic adjustment of beam directions and power will result in reduced radiation and energy consumption.

title: Energy efficiency improvements
description: AI enabled JSAC can dynamically adjust resource usage for sensing and communication according to real-time channel environment conditions. This will lead to more efficient operation and hence, energy savings. Also, AI will enable energy-efficient sensing operations by intelligently optimizing energy usage while collecting information.

title: Energy efficiency improvements
description: The ability to adapt symbol modulation to channel conditions will result in enhanced spectral efficiency and minimized retransmission.

title: Energy Efficiency improvements
description: DCI compression techniques will reduce the bandwidth needed to transmit the same control data.

title: Energy Efficiency improvements
description: The ability to extract abstract semantic concepts from complex use-cases reduces the amount of data that needs to be transmitted for control purposes. This implicitly reduces transmit power.

title: Energy Efficiency improvements
description: Smart subband selection strategies will minimize the collision rate, and with it, the energy wasted in unnecessary transmissions.

title: Energy Efficiency improvements
description: The ability to predict confidence in point predictions will necessarily improve control algorithms in multiple fields, among them, radio resource allocation.

title: Energy Efficiency improvements
description: Smart clustering of cell free access points will optimize the transmit power needed to achieve a target capacity, while minimizing unnecessary radiation and energy waste.

title: Energy efficiency
description: ORIGAMI's CCL (Compute Continuum Layer) will allow multiplexing a heterogeneous computing fabric comprised of energy-hungry yet powerful resources and energy-light yet capped resources.

title: Reduced Energy Consumption
description: Use of a dynamic, automated, AI-driven optimization of the usage of RAN resources.

title: Reduce travel and associated emissions
description: Holographic meeting instead of travel, smartphones. In-cloud processing for reducing overall energy consumption. Live validations digitally signed by digital video processing.

title: Increased area of protected and surveyed natural habitats and climate preserves
description: The AR/VR demo UC of the project could be extended to rescue operations.

title: Number of exhausted batteries
description: 6G network would enable the feasibility of occupational exoskeletons with offloaded control. This would in turn enable the delocalization of part of the exoskeleton's hardware, which would lead to a reduction in the exoskeleton's power consumption.

title: Measures the reduction of the carbon footprint associated to travels
description: Measures the reduction of the carbon footprint associated to travels by eliminating the physical meetings Within local and global communities, asset logistics and other transportation through the adoption of collaborative DT environments.

title: Resources optimization
description: Resources (material, energy, equipment, supply chain, personal, etc.) optimization due to the decentralized location of the people and assets. Then, the optimal allocation of the resources can be selected according to the restrictions in place or organizational decisions.

title: Allowing stakeholders to monitor energy usage patterns
description: Allowing stakeholders to monitor energy usage patterns promptly and make informed decisions to optimize energy efficiency.

title: Measures the framework's capability to facilitate sharing
description: Measures the framework's capability to facilitate sharing of energy data with relevant stakeholders.

title: Improved energy efficiency by providing accurate measurements
description: Improved energy efficiency by providing accurate and real-time energy measurements and energy balancing as a whole system.

title: The electricity prices to calculate the cost
description: The electricity prices to calculate the cost of operating the system.

title: Quantifies the level of precision
description: It quantifies the level of precision achieved in measuring E2E energy measurement framework, expressed as a percentage of accuracy.

title: Assesses the reduction in greenhouse gas emissions
description: Assesses the reduction in greenhouse gas emissions achieved through the use case, promoting a more sustainable and environmentally friendly energy system.

title: KVI 1: Optimisation of EMF for given coverage. KVI 2: Optimisation of Energy Footprint for given services
description: Stakeholder: Providers & Users Effect on: State of Being KVI1 description: Low EMF. KVI2 description: Lower Energy Consumption.

title: KVI 1: Optimisation of Energy Footprint for given services
description: Stakeholder: Providers & Users Effect on: State of Being KV1 description: Lower Energy Consumption. KV2 description: Lower Energy Resources utilisation.

title: To reduce footprint on energy, resources, and emissions
description: Improved device/App/Service energy efficiency. Improve sustainability in other parts of society and industry.

title: Increases lifespan of products and services
description: Keeping technology and related services in action longer reduces e-waste and resources mined. Improved durability of technology or service via ability to refurbish, repair, and upgrade in ways that are acceptable to users/consumers.

title: Greater understanding of environmental challenges
description: The ability to better understand the environmental footprints being produced by the innovation. Increased number of environmental factors monitored for.

title: Resource Usage Optimization
description: Efficiency in resource allocation in cloud and edge computing environments to minimize idle processing power and unnecessary storage. Measurement unit: resource utilization percentage or efficiency rate.

title: Waste Reduction
description: The amount of electronic waste generated due to hardware upgrades or obsolescence by the ENVELOPE use case compared to baseline. A reduction in hardware devices required by the ENVELOPE use case compared to baseline (for instance having a more efficient architecture with less hardware nodes) would mean a reduction in hardware waste.

title: Carbon Footprint Reduction
description: The total CO2 emissions generated by the operation of the ENVELOPE use case compared with state of the art or baseline.

title: Energy Consumption
description: The amount of energy consumed (kwh) by the ENVELOPE use case compared with the baseline.

title: Travel Time Emissions
description: Assesses the reduction of average travel time spent by citizens. Rerouting with more optimal paths can be achieved due to the information sharing.

title: Optimisation of Energy Footprint for given services
description: Stakeholders addressed: Providers & Users. Low Energy Consumption / Low Energy Resources utilization.

title: Environmental footprint of urban transport of persons and goods
description: Precise positioning / localization.

title: Energy efficiency improvements
description: Provisioning of traffic flows achieving 50% reduction of the energy consumption.

title: Equal opportunities for accessing holographic communication for everyone with a smartphone
description: Smartphones, Low-cost XR capture and display gadgets, Software Development Kits (SDKs) for integrating holographic comms in third-party XR products.

title: EMF aware networks
description: Smart clustering of cell-free access points will optimize the transmit power needed to achieve a target capacity, while minimizing unnecessary radiation and energy waste.

title: Reduced emergency response times due to critical event detection and localization
description: The AR/VR demo UC of the project could be extended to rescue operations.

title: Increased operational efficiency in critical missions
description: The AR/VR demo UC of the project could be extended to rescue operations.

title: Cost of care of work-related injuries
description: 6G network would enable the integration of occupational exoskeletons with network sensors and offloaded control algorithms. This reduces exoskeleton weight/cost and optimizes assistance, potentially reducing the number/severity of work-related injuries and treatment costs.

title: Diversity among factory personnel
description: Remote support and overlay in Extended Reality (XR) device may allow for less skilled workers or workers with disabilities to perform tasks on the factory floor.

title: Remote collaboration enhances societal and team productivity/efficiency
description: Digital presence, Rural and industrial equality, Telepresence.

title: Measures productivity and efficiency in remote teamwork
description: VR telepresence and remote control. (Also addresses reduction of regional disparities of rural area).

title: Ensure the adherence to ethical practices in place in both manufacturing and sociological practices
description: Proof of ethical compliance and channel to introduce potential ethical limitations. Register potential deviations of the ethical politics and ensure corrective actions.

title: Less Stressful Mobility
description: Assesses the decrease in stress levels of citizens when using ENVELOPE mobility solutions compared to baseline.

title: Trust In CCAM
description: Evaluates the level of public trust and willingness to adopt CCAM (Cooperative, Connected and Automated Mobility) technologies.

title: Increase Users
description: More users can be served with the ENVELOPE use case compared with the baseline; Gr-UC6 achieves accurate local situation awareness and provides traffic information notifications to a wide range of users.

title: Increased cost savings in agricultural activities
description: How do advanced features of 6G save operational costs in agricultural activities through efficient crop management practices (ex, water saving/pesticide saving)?

title: Operational cost savings
description: How does the 6G-facilitated 3D hydrogel patch service contribute to reducing transportation costs for patients and healthcare systems, hospital admission costs, the overall cost of medical equipment and maintenance?

title: Time savings
description: How does the 6G facilitate 3D hydrogel patches service contribute to saving cost (time for patients to travel and wait, time of hospitalisation, connectivity speed, and computation time).

title: Increased profits
description: How do advanced features of 6G contribute to increasing the profits from agriculture through efficient crop management practices (ex, water saving/pesticide saving)?

title: Increased productivity in agricultural activities
description: How do advanced features of 6G increase the agriculture production/yield and quality resulting from timely interventions based on real-time data monitoring?

title: Increased operational efficiency in agricultural activities
description: How do advanced features of 6G help to increase operational efficiency through automation and real-time monitoring to streamline the farming process?

title: Resource Utilization Optimization
description: How do advanced features of 6G contribute to optimal resource utilization by reducing water consumption through precise irrigation scheduling enabled by real-time soil moisture monitoring, and decreasing fertilizer usage reducing waste and costs?

title: Revenue Growth
description: How do advanced features of 6G contribute to increasing the revenue through market expansion (due to enhanced product quality), premium pricing, and the creation of new revenue opportunities (agritourism, eco-certifications, etc.)?

title: Operational Efficiency
description: How does the 6G facilitated 3D hydrogel patches service contribute to operational efficiency through streamlined operations, reducing the time and resources needed per patient?

title: Economic Development
description: How does the 6G facilitated 3D hydrogel patches service contribute to enhancing the economic stability of remote areas by providing essential services locally?

title: OPEX reductions (In-context learning)
description: In-context learning is a data-efficient form of meta-learning that does not require explicit optimization at run time, enabling the network to quickly adapt to changing conditions, reducing sample and computational complexity.

title: CAPEX reductions (CSI compression)
description: CSI compression will result in reduced bandwidth requirement for CSI feedback translating to minimized need for spectrum licenses.

title: CAPEX reductions (MIMO precoding)
description: AIML based MIMO precoding will enhance spectral efficiency translating to reduction in capital investments for acquiring more spectrum.

title: CAPEX reductions (JSAC)
description: JSAC (Joint Sensing and Communication) will reduce the need for separate networks and devices, translating to CAPEX reductions via elimination of the investment required to deploy and maintain separate systems.

title: CAPEX reductions (Neural Receiver)
description: The developed neural receiver will improve the system's spectral efficiency, translating to reduction in capital investments for acquiring more spectrum.

title: CAPEX reductions (Beam Management)
description: AIML optimised beam management will lead to improved coverage in specific areas translating to a reduction in the need for additional gNBs or infrastructure to cover the same area.

title: OPEX reductions (DCI compression)
description: DCI compression will increase network capacity and help the network serve more users in the same bandwidth, allowing operating margins to grow.

title: CAPEX reductions (Protocols)
description: The ability to automatically produce protocols to solve a concrete use-case will reduce development efforts significantly.

title: Reduced CAPEX
description: Compute-aware virtualized RAN solutions that can build reliable RAN systems that improve cost and energy-efficiency.

title: Cost efficiency
description: A system that discovers and monitors available resources from different providers can select the most cost efficient and higher performance components maintained by each provider.

title: Business Value
description: Business impact and migration guidelines towards 6G scenarios.

title: Economic Growth
description: Business impact and migration guidelines towards 6G scenarios.

title: Increased use of robots in industrial activities
description: Highlights the potential increase in the use of robots if xURLLC services are supported (Linked to Robotic Digital Twin UC).

title: Increased productivity in factory work
description: Highlights the potential increase in the use of robots if xURLLC services are supported (Linked to Robotic Digital Twin UC).

title: Cost savings associated to travel expenses
description: Centralized team measuring the cost savings associated to the use of holographic communications (travel, accommodation, logistics, time improvement).

title: Other improvements associated to implementation
description: Covers industrial gaps such as supply chain optimization, remote inspections, functional collaboration, and real-time interactions.

title: Economical improvements associated to production
description: Improvements in productivity and efficiency through the adoption of DT (Digital Twin) environment. Partially enabled by the ability to differentiate and customize production.

title: Reduction of Total Cost of Ownership for service provisioning
description: Economically efficient solution for providers and economically efficient service provisioning to end users.

title: People's access and the potential spread of impact
description: Seamless compatibility for evolution to new capabilities without requiring new infrastructure or devices.

title: Ability to support additional functionality and content
description: 6G systems set up to support the entry of new players with new functionality and content they can control, maintaining healthy local economies and user control.

title: Operational Cost Savings
description: Assesses the savings in vehicle operation and maintenance due to optimized routes, reduced idling, and real-time information sharing.

title: CapEx Reduction
description: Cost reduction in acquiring, upgrading, and maintaining physical assets in comparison to baseline.

title: Time To Market Reduction
description: Tracks the time taken to develop and launch new solutions or technologies (e.g., easier software updates, virtualization of tests).

title: OpEx Reduction
description: Cost reduction for running the ENVELOPE system/service (day-to-day expenses) in comparison to baseline.

title: Increase Productivity
description: Measures the improvement in productivity due to automation and optimization compared to baseline (e.g., less time spent by fleet supervisors).

title: Reduction of TCO for service provisioning
description: Economically efficient solution provided to network operators. Economically efficient service provisioning to end users/other actors.

title: Increased footprint of gaming services
description: The Cloud Rendered Gaming UC highlight the potential increase of gaming services.

title: More users can be served with improved service quality
description: Design and develop NI functionalities and global APIs that enable global deployment of services (e.g., IoT hyperscalers) with multi-domain performance guarantees.

title: Demonstration of in-band intelligence
description: Design and develop NI functionalities and global APIs that enable global deployment of services (e.g., IoT hyperscalers) with multi-domain performance guarantees.

title: A cloud native implementation of the Service Communication Proxy (SCP)
description: Design and develop NI functionalities and global APIs that enable global deployment of services (e.g., IoT hyperscalers) with multi-domain performance guarantees.

title: Measures fair opportunity as accessibility and user interface for industrial production by the DT participation
description: VR telepresence and remote control, VR UI, accessibility Digital accessibility supplementing potential limitations of people interacting with the Digital Twin like hand disabilities (i.e., voice interaction) Telepresence in a common digital environment Accessible immersive UI EAA guidelines.

title: Increased number of thematic gaming
description: The Cloud Rendered Gaming UC highlight the potential increase of gaming services.

title: The ability to help all people make the most of 5G to improve their ability to actively participate in cultural elements of society.
description: People expect they will have access to participate in their communities as enabled by the service.

title: Increased presence of agriculture sector
description: How does the 6G-PATH project ensure knowledge transfer and adoption of advanced irrigation technologies using 6G among local farmers?

title: Digital leadership
description: How does this service contribute to providing devices for connected home health services?

title: Enhanced Quality of Life
description: How does this service contribute to improved quality of life for patients by allowing them to maintain a more normal lifestyle with fewer disruptions due to medical appointments?

title: Societal Upgrade
description: How does this service contribute to better adoption of eHealth services by reducing the need for travelling of chronic patients?

title: Increased presence of 6G in agriculture sector
description: How does the 6G-PATH project ensure knowledge transfer and adoption of advanced irrigation technologies using 6G among local farmers?

title: Increased access to live lectures seminars and conferences enabled thanks to holographic communications
description: Retention of the lectures content via digital recording, training activities, virtual visit to cultural heritage and touristic places, virtual attendance to events.

title: Enhancements of the training activities using holograms communications
description: Rapid and effective skills acquisition, know-how retention within upper organizations, standardization of the pedagogical way to transmit the content, and SDK which improves the training creation process.

title: Easiness to use of accessible Hardware (HW)
description: Holographic meeting, smartphones, rapid and effective skills acquisition, budget-friendly HW in which holographic communications can be operated, and globalization of the compatible HW.

title: Measure the increased participation and involvement of the local community
description: Utilization rate of the application and usability, cultural exchange, amount of content stored in the environment, and number of ideas generated.

title: Increase in # of educational/cultural products available as immersive services
description: Remote/Live Participation in education (KVI1) and economically efficient participation in education and cultural products (KVI2).

title: Increase in areas (population/coverage) having access to these products
description: Broader population and coverage access to educational and cultural products.

title: Increase in # of educational products
description: Remote, high-quality participation in education (lessons, material, etc.) that are available as immersive services.

title: Reported confidence in sustainable digital devices, systems, and services used in the use-case development and operation- to be updated
description: % of the users expressing positive evaluation regarding the sustainability of the devices, network, developed applications and services.

title: Reported perceived security of the digital devices, systems, and services used in the use-case development and operation.
description: % of the users expressing positive evaluation regarding the secureness of the devices and of the E2E system.

title: Security
description: Security resilience is defined as the ability to adapt and recover from challenging and unforeseen situations.

title: Optimized and secure infrastructure
description: Monitoring resources from different providers to identify anomalies and intrusion detection

title: Measure the effectiveness of the privacy and security of 3D DT environments. Key points to check are user data, privacy and confidentiality, and other potential security leaks. Virtual interaction needs to comply with general and industry standards.
description: VR telepresence avatars, edge cloud, E2E communications SDK to implement masks in communication and video streaming Edge and cloud combination to reduce potential points of attack Encrypted information

title: % of collected use case user security concerns that are addressed.
description: Ensuring that as the complexity of networking increases, the systems, platforms, and apps consider the security needs of the organisations and users who are impacted by these tools.

title: % of collected use case user privacy concerns that are addressed.
description: Ensuring that as the complexity of networking increases, the systems, platforms, and apps consider the privacy needs of the users and citizens who are impacted by these tools.

title: Increased time savings in agricultural activities
description: How do advanced features of 6G save time through efficient crop management practices?

title: Increased user satisfaction
description: What is the users' level of satisfaction with the advanced features of 6G in the agriculture process?

title: Increased ease of use
description: What is the users' level of satisfaction with the ease of using the advanced features of 6G in the agriculture process?

title: Increased network reliability
description: What is the users' rating on the accuracy of using advanced features of 6G without disruptions in agricultural activities?

title: Increased data reliability
description: What is users' rating on the accuracy and consistency of data collected from sensors and drones using advanced features of 6G to support decision-making processes in agriculture?

title: Increased data accessibility
description: What is the users' rating on the ease of access to real-time data on hydric states, weather conditions, and crop phenology using advanced features of 6G?

title: Increased system scalability
description: What is the users' rating on the ability of advanced features of 6G to handle increasing volumes of data and expanding sensor networks as the crop cultivation operations grow?

title: Increased trust
description: What is the users' rating of the overall trustworthiness of 6G advanced features in agricultural activities?

title: Reliability and Stability
description: What are the user experiences regarding the reliability and stability of smart vineyard technologies, including network connectivity and data processing?

title: Adaptability to Conditions
description: What is the user feedback on the system's adaptability to varying vineyard conditions, such as changes in weather or crop health?

title: Seamless Integration
description: What is the operator feedback on the integration of different components (Crates, Terraview OS, AAVs, AGVs) with 6G technology and their smooth functioning together?

title: Increased operational efficiency
description: What is users' feedback on how real-time data and analytics from the smart vineyard system have improved their decision-making processes and, on the speed, and effectiveness of responses to vineyard issues, such as pest infestations or equipment malfunctions?

title: Technology Adoption
description: How does this service contribute to secured and reliable small nomadic networks designed for eHealth?

title: Perceived easiness, enjoyment and emotional quality of the experience in the venue
description: Questionnaires, 5-point likert scale, Partial least squares structural equation model (PLS-SEM).

title: Perceived easiness, enjoyment and emotional quality of the experience at home
description: Questionnaires, 5-point likert scale, Partial least squares structural equation model (PLS-SEM).

title: Perceived usefulness and ease of use
description: Questionnaires, 5-point likert scale, Partial least squares structural equation model (PLS-SEM).

title: Increased options for in-home entertainment
description: The Cloud Rendered Gaming UC highlight the potential increase of gaming services.

title: Food security and availability
description: How does using advanced agriculture practices facilitated by 6G improve the contribution to local food security by improving the yield and quality of grapes and ensuring a stable supply for local markets?

title: Virtual meetings contribute to saving time due to unnecessary travels
description: Family and work balance, Productivity, Enhancement of the people who focus on their comfort zone, SDK standardization of the meeting rooms with the necessary interactive material.

title: Reduced travel and immersive experience which improve quality of life by saving time and increasing quality of communication
description: Holographic meeting and smartphones.

title: Reduced travel and immersive experience which improve quality of life by saving time and increasing quality of communication
description: Utilization rate of the application and usability, and accessibility.

title: Improvement of the communications and effectiveness of the information shared while people's time is saved as no travel is needed
description: Utilization rates of the application, Time saved while using the application in comparison with travel, Reduction of misunderstandings due to the immersion of the solution.

title: Increase in # events available as immersive services
description: Remote/Live Participation in various events (enabled by Immersive services support).

title: Increase in areas (population/coverage) having access to these events
description: Resource efficient Manufacturing; Enablement of Industry 5.0.

title: Flexible to adapt to new requirements, use contexts, and new use objectives
description: Alternative approaches possible for each system configuration.

title: Optimal resource allocation
description: Ability to Scale System with Need or System functions as needed in different contexts.

title: Process components can be reconfigured without losing function
description: The ability to implement and deploy a system in the regions where it can provide the most benefit.

title: Digital inclusion
description: Digital Inclusion and Equitable Access.

title: Easiness of using accessible Hardware (HW), which improves the digital inclusion of the whole society.
description: Includes holographic-meeting, smartphones, rapid and effective skills acquisition, budget-friendly HW in which holographic communications can be operated, globalization of compatible HW, easy-to-use HW, and a variety of versions to match different society use cases.

title: Measures fair opportunity as accessibility and user interface for industrial production by the DT participation.
description: Involves VR telepresence and remote control, VR UI, and digital accessibility supplementing potential limitations of people interacting with the Digital Twin (e.g., hand disabilities via voice interaction) in a common digital environment, following EAA guidelines.

title: Social and digital inclusion (reducing the digital divide of who has access, serving the historically under-served to be able to fully participate in activities and society).
description: Access to service for all users.

title: More users can be served with improved service quality.
description: Design and develop NI functionalities and global APIs that enable global deployment of services (e.g., IoT hyperscalers) with multi-domain performance guarantees.

title: KVI1: Increase in coverage footprint
description: Connecting the unconnected thus fostering inclusion of remote populations in digital services. (Stakeholder: Users; Effect on: Activities).

title: Acting in ways that enable communities to prosper, support the needs of all, including the under-represented, and bridge the digital divide.
description: The ability to show that these innovations matter not just for the mainstream and wealthy (e.g., those with easy access) but that they can support the lives and well-being of all.

title: Increase accessibility for people with disabilities or those who are unable to travel
description: Covers holographic meetings and smartphones to break physical/geographic barriers and reduce costs; includes SDK functionalities allowing users to change hologram appearance to cover potential disabilities; and ensures connectivity in remote regions.

title: Increased contribution to food security
description: How do advanced features of 6G contribute to maintaining a stable agricultural food supply by improving crop resilience to climate change and optimizing resource utilization in agricultural production?

title: Increased contribution to public health and nutrition
description: How do advanced features of 6G contribute to better nutritional outcomes for the local population by improving the quality and availability of agricultural products?

title: Improved Public health
description: How does this service contribute to improved health service to the patients by visiting patients (reducing the number of missed hospital visits) while at the same time serving multiple patients with a reduced number of highly trained personnel?

title: Increased workforce safety and health
description: How does using advanced agriculture practices facilitated by 6G improve worker safety and health conditions due to the reduction of manual labour-intensive tasks and the implementation of autonomous machinery?

title: Improved Healthcare Access
description: How does this service contribute to increased access to high-quality medical care for patients in remote and underserved areas?

title: Reduction in healing time
description: How does this service wound healing time duration compared to conventional dressings?

title: Empowerment of Healthcare Providers
description: How does this service contribute to enhanced job satisfaction and professional growth opportunities for nurses and other healthcare providers with advanced tools and remote support?

title: Resilience in Healthcare Delivery
description: How does this service contribute to the continuity of care during emergencies or natural disasters, improving community resilience?

title: Increased operational efficiency in saving lives in remote areas
description: The AR/VR demo UC of the project could be extended to rescue operations.

title: Reduced injuries in the human workforce
description: The Robotic Digital Twin UC and the Robot Control UC highlight the potential increase in the use of robots if xURLLC services are supported.

title: Number/Severity of work-related injuries and Indicators of workers' well-being
description: 6G network would enable the integration of occupational exoskeletons to reduce physical load, improve quality of work, and potentially decrease the number/severity of work-related injuries.

title: Number of required devices/production facilities
description: Adaptive production lines allow to produce different types of products on the same production system. This reduces the need for materials by reusing the same processing modules for multiple production lines.

title: Number of killed wild animals
description: Automated wildlife detection via drones flying ahead of a harvesting machine may prevent wild animals to be killed.

title: Safe activities via realistic holo-portation
description: Costs and risks minimization, increased user confidence, and hands-on safety collaboration by avoiding risky situations in terms of machinery manipulation or dangerous environments.

title: The ability to use tools while keeping a focus on the final goals
description: The ability to make the decisions at difficult times requires that users do not have to focus on their work with the tools but instead they are able to use the tools to support the vulnerable people they are seeking to protect.

title: Citizens Feeling safe
description: Stakeholder perception of personal and community safety resulting from solution use.

title: Greater protection of citizens by better understanding hazards
description: Information needs to be the right kind for the right person for the right kind of assessment in order for a public safety practitioner to be able to do their jobs. Improved awareness of vulnerabilities and risks faced by citizens.

title: Improve practitioners' ability to perform and make necessary decisions
description: Tools need to be usable in both training exercises and day-to-day activities by public safety organisations to be valuable. Trainings with the system are able to be aligned with organisational objectives and goals.

title: Security matches sensitive nature of user and data
description: The ability for a system to work in ways that support the unique security needs of mission critical work. Confidentiality of sensitive information.

title: Accident Rate Reduction
description: Assesses the effectiveness of ENVELOPE solutions in preventing accidents.

title: Increase of communication services availability
description: Decrease in communication outages in emergency/disastrous situations (Fast response and mitigation of disastrous situations).

title: Faster response in environmental or man-caused incidents
description: Faster response in incidents especially affecting large areas (Fast response and mitigation of disastrous situations).

title: Increase in the number of incidents mitigated
description: Mitigation thanks to the availability of communication services/PPDR advanced services.

title: Injuries in urban traffic
description: Joint communication and sensing; Multi-agent supporting network architecture (evaluated through connected LiDAR, connected radar, and AI-assisted energy efficiency).

title: Level of Trustworthiness
description: Level of trustworthiness provided to a user is the result of combined actions taken by the cognitive AI coordinator of the 6G system simultaneously at the application plane, core network plane, and resource/cloud continuum plane. It involves deploying Trust Functions to apply security, privacy, safety, resilience, and reliability actions satisfying the user's intent.

title: Reported confidence in the digital devices, systems, and services used in the use-case development and operation.
description: % of the users expressing positive evaluation regarding the robustness of the devices, the trustworthiness of the used AI algorithms, and the E2E privacy of the system.

title: Level of Trustworthiness
description: Trustworthiness encompasses multiple facets, such as security, privacy, availability, resilience, and compliance with ethical frameworks. It is calculated as a combination of several metrics (e.g., Attestation level, Traffic path attestation, Traceability, Security issues) into a Level of Trust (LoT) concept.

title: Facial relief visualization of the people we are interacting with helps in the enhancement of the inter-personal relations. Then, it increases the level of thrustless, cooperation, and understanding.
description: Holographic meeting, Smart devices SDK to measure the trust level of the people you are interacting with.

title: Users trust a system's behaviour, process, and governance; Users trust fellow users; Users trust infrastructures and networks.
description: Building systems that continue to be trusted by users and society. Building an understanding of how one element of a trusted system, dependability, works in different domains and activities might relate to different technical features. Stakeholders deem the system dependable for their activities.

title: Able to perform the session successfully, no matter their location
description: Able to perform the session successfully, no matter their location. User has tolerance of disconnection or gaps in service in how they use it.
